title: 16. An Exit Interview with N.I.H. Director Dr. Francis Collins
description: The National Institutes of Health is the backbone of health research in the U.S., and Collins has been in charge for more than a decade. Now that he’s stepping down, he ponders the arc of his history-making career, from his leadership of the Human Genome Project to the fight against Covid-19 (not to mention the absolute happiest moment of his life).
author: bapu@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
